FuncDef:
The terminal session-log disable command disables the session log function for the current connection.
The undo terminal session-log disable command enables the session log function for the current connection.
By default, the session log function is enabled for the current connection.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The session log function saves session information, including user input, screen output, and the time when a device executes commands to a session log file. If this function is not required for the current connection, you can run the terminal session-log disable command to disable the function.
Precautions
Before enabling the session log function for the current connection, run the undo info-center session log disable command to enable the global session log function.
